member.name: M:ECommons.Automation.Chat.SendMessageUnsafe(System.Byte[])

summary.para: Send a given message to the chat box. This can send chat to the server.

This method is unsafe. This method does no checking on your input and may send content to the server that the normal client could not. You must verify what you're sending and handle content and length to properly use this.

member.name: T:ECommons.Automation.NeoTaskManager.TaskManagerConfiguration
member.summary: Configuration class that defines TaskManager's behavior. In case task's configuration is not set or any it's property is null, default task manager configuration will be used. Default configuration is always present and can't have null properties.

member.name: P:ECommons.Automation.NeoTaskManager.TaskManagerConfiguration.TimeLimitMS
member.summary: After this amount of time task will fail. Default is 30000 (30s).

member.name: P:ECommons.Automation.NeoTaskManager.TaskManagerConfiguration.AbortOnTimeout
member.summary: Whether to clear entire queue of tasks if one of them times out. Otherwise, only timed out task will be discarded and the rest will continue to execute. Default is true.

member.name: P:ECommons.Automation.NeoTaskManager.TaskManagerConfiguration.AbortOnError
member.summary: Whether to clear entire queue of tasks if one of them produces an exception. Otherwise, only errored task will be discarded and the rest will continue to execute. Default is true.

member.name: P:ECommons.Automation.NeoTaskManager.TaskManagerConfiguration.TimeoutSilently
member.summary: Whether to suppress any output when task times out. Default is false.

member.name: P:ECommons.Automation.NeoTaskManager.TaskManagerConfiguration.ShowDebug
member.summary: Whether to output debug information to console. Use in development or testing. Default is false.

member.name: P:ECommons.Automation.NeoTaskManager.TaskManagerConfiguration.ShowError
member.summary: Whether to output errors to console. Default is true.

member.name: P:ECommons.Automation.NeoTaskManager.TaskManagerConfiguration.ExecuteDefaultConfigurationEvents
member.summary: Whether to always execute events that are registered in default configuration. Otherwise, default configuration's events will only be used when per-task configuration is missing. Default is true.

Whether to change abort behavior. Keep to apply configuration settings, change to to abort entire operation, change to to only discard errored task. Has no effect if was set to .

member.name: T:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1
member.summary:
Circular buffer.
When writing to a full buffer: PushBack -> removes this[0] / Front() PushFront -> removes this[Size-1] / Back()
this implementation is inspired by http://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_53_0/libs/circular_buffer/doc/circular_buffer.html because I liked their interface.

member.name: F:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1._start
member.summary: The _start. Index of the first element in buffer.

member.name: F:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1._end
member.summary: The _end. Index after the last element in the buffer.

member.name: F:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1._size
member.summary: The _size. Buffer size.

member.name: M:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1.#ctor(System.Int32,`0[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Items to fill buffer with. Items length must be less than capacity. Suggestion: use Skip(x).Take(y).ToArray() to build this argument from any enumerable.

member.name: P:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1.Capacity
member.summary: Maximum capacity of the buffer. Elements pushed into the buffer after maximum capacity is reached (IsFull = true), will remove an element.

member.name: P:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1.IsFull
member.summary: Boolean indicating if Circular is at full capacity. Adding more elements when the buffer is full will cause elements to be removed from the other end of the buffer.

member.name: P:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1.IsEmpty
member.summary: True if has no elements.

member.name: P:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1.Size
member.summary: Current buffer size (the number of elements that the buffer has).

member.name: M:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1.Front
member.summary: Element at the front of the buffer - this[0].
member.returns: The value of the element of type T at the front of the buffer.

member.name: M:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1.Back
member.summary: Element at the back of the buffer - this[Size - 1].
member.returns: The value of the element of type T at the back of the buffer.

member.name: P:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Index access to elements in buffer. Index does not loop around like when adding elements, valid interval is [0;Size[
member.exception: Thrown when index is outside of [; Size[ interval.

member.name: M:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1.PushBack(`0)
member.summary:
Pushes a new element to the back of the buffer. Back()/this[Size-1] will now return this element.
When the buffer is full, the element at Front()/this[0] will be popped to allow for this new element to fit.
member.param: Item to push to the back of the buffer

member.name: M:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1.PushFront(`0)
member.summary:
Pushes a new element to the front of the buffer. Front()/this[0] will now return this element.
When the buffer is full, the element at Back()/this[Size-1] will be popped to allow for this new element to fit.
member.param: Item to push to the front of the buffer

member.name: M:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1.PopBack
member.summary: Removes the element at the back of the buffer. Decreasing the Buffer size by 1.

member.name: M:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1.PopFront
member.summary: Removes the element at the front of the buffer. Decreasing the Buffer size by 1.

member.name: M:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1.Clear
member.summary: Clears the contents of the array. Size = 0, Capacity is unchanged.

member.name: M:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1.ToArray
member.summary: Copies the buffer contents to an array, according to the logical contents of the buffer (i.e. independent of the internal order/contents)
member.returns: A new array with a copy of the buffer contents.

member.name: M:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1.ToArraySegments
member.summary:
Get the contents of the buffer as 2 ArraySegments. Respects the logical contents of the buffer, where each segment and items in each segment are ordered according to insertion.
Fast: does not copy the array elements. Useful for methods like Send(IList<ArraySegment<Byte>>).
Segments may be empty.
member.returns: An IList with 2 segments corresponding to the buffer content.

member.name: M:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through this buffer.
member.returns: An enumerator that can be used to iterate this collection.

member.name: M:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1.Increment(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Increments the provided index variable by one, wrapping around if necessary.

member.name: M:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1.Decrement(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Decrements the provided index variable by one, wrapping around if necessary.

member.name: M:ECommons.CircularBuffers.CircularBuffer`1.InternalIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the index in the argument to an index in _buffer

member.name: T:ECommons.Configuration.EzConfig
member.summary: A class that aims to significantly simplify working with Dalamud configuration. 1. Does not includes type definitions, which allows changing underlying type if it can be deserialized from existing data (list into array...) 2. Provides anti-corruption mechanism, reducing chance of data loss if game crashes or power goes off during configuration writing 3. Allows to very easily load default configuration as well as additional configuration, taking path to config folder into account. 4. Allows you to redefine serializer with your own implementation upon serializing or in general for the whole EzConfig module. 5. Solves the issues with default Dalamud serialization settings where default values of collection will stay in addition to ones that were deserialized.

member.summary: Default serialization factory. Create a class that extends SerializationFactory, implement your own serializer and deserializer and assign DefaultSerializationFactory to it before loading any configurations to change serializer to your own liking.

member.name: T:ECommons.EzIpcManager.EzIPC
member.summary:
Provides easier way to interact with Dalamud IPC.
See EzIPC.md for example use.

member.name: E:ECommons.EzIpcManager.EzIPC.OnSafeInvocationException
member.summary: Event that fires whenever an exception occurs in any of safe invocation wrapper methods.

member.name: M:ECommons.EzIpcManager.EzIPC.Init(System.Object,System.String,ECommons.EzIpcManager.SafeWrapper)
member.summary:
Initializes IPC provider and subscriber for an instance type. Static methods or field/properties/properties will be ignored, register them separately via static Init if you must.
Each method that have or will be registered for IPC under "Prefix.IPCName" tag. If prefix is not specified, it is your plugin's internal name. If IPCName is not specified, it is method name.
Each Action and Function field/property that have will be assigned delegate that represents respective GetIPCSubscriber. Each Action field/property that have will be assigned to become respective tag's event trigger. Make sure to explicitly specify prefix if you're interacting with other plugin's IPC.
You do not need to dispose IPC methods in any way. Everything is disposed upon calling .
member.param: Instance of a class that has EzIPC methods and field/properties/properties.

Type of a safe invocation wrapper to be used for IPC calls. Wrappers, when used, will silently drop exceptions and return default object if invocation has failed. You can subscribe to event to observe these exceptions.
member.returns: Array of disposal tokens that can be used to dispose registered providers and event subscription. Typical use of EzIPC never has any need to store and deal with these tokens; you only ever need them when you want to unregister IPC before your plugin's Dispose method is called.

member.name: M:ECommons.EzIpcManager.EzIPC.Init(System.Type,System.String,ECommons.EzIpcManager.SafeWrapper)
member.summary:
Initializes IPC provider and subscriber for a static type.
Each method that have or will be registered for IPC under "Prefix.IPCName" tag. If prefix is not specified, it is your plugin's internal name. If IPCName is not specified, it is method name.
Each Action and Function field/property that have will be assigned delegate that represents respective GetIPCSubscriber. Each Action field/property that have will be assigned to become respective tag's event trigger. Make sure to explicitly specify prefix if you're interacting with other plugin's IPC.
You do not need to dispose IPC methods in any way. Everything is disposed upon calling .
member.param: Type of a static class that has EzIPC methods and field/properties/properties.

Type of a safe invocation wrapper to be used for IPC calls. Wrappers, when used, will silently drop exceptions and return default object if invocation has failed. You can subscribe to event to observe these exceptions.
member.returns: Array of disposal tokens that can be used to dispose registered providers and event subscription. Typical use of EzIPC never has any need to store and deal with these tokens; you only ever need them when you want to unregister IPC before your plugin's Dispose method is called.

member.name: T:ECommons.EzSharedDataManager.EzSharedData
member.summary: EzSharedData class aims to resolve following problems with built-in SharedData service. - It will automatically relinquish data upon plugin disposal, unless specifically instructed otherwise - You can use TryGet continuously and there will ever be only one usage instance, you do not have to worry about holding reference yourself. Although, this is slower than creating and holding reference yourself so please obtain and hold reference to the data in performance-critical functions such as Framework Update.

member.name: M:ECommons.EzSharedDataManager.EzSharedData.TryGet``1(System.String,``0@,ECommons.EzSharedDataManager.CreationMode,``0)
member.summary: Attempts to get existing data or create new data.
member.typeparam: Data type. Note that only reference type works. If you need to use value type, use array and put one element there. Only .NET, Dalamud and Dalamud's libraries types; no submodules, nuget packages and your own custom-defined types. If you need to share complex structure, please use tuples and Alias any type feature https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/proposals/csharp-12.0/using-alias-types
member.param: Shared data name. Please prefix it with your plugin's name.
Creation mode, if any is needed.
Default value when creating data that doesn't exists.

member.name: T:ECommons.UIHelpers.AddonMasterImplementations.AddonMaster
member.summary:
A class that contains useful methods for addons.
If you want to add an addon:
- Inherit AddonMasterBase
- Make sure that class is named exactly as addon;
- Make sure that class is a nested class inside partial AddonMaster class;
- Make sure to implement both nint and void* constructors
- Prefer NOT to use indexes; instead, create an array of entries and create internal method to click an item. See RetainerList and SelectString for examples.
Ideally, automatic method should run as much checks as possible to disallow selecting disabled entries, entering values outside of range into checkboxes, etc. If something allows doing that, do not rely on it as ultimately the goal is to only allow 100% valid inputs.
